projects.title: Multi-sensory and multivocal collection presentation - Delinking & Relinking
projects.description:
The developments within the Van Abbemuseum focus on inclusion, particularly with regard to polyphony and multi-sensory perception. A striking example of this is the collection presentation 'Dwarsverbanden' ('Delinking & Relinking'), which openend on 18 September 2021. The museum project team (curators, depot, archive, technical department, marcom, fundraising, etc.) has been joined by a large group of partners and professionals. Their perspectives made our blind spots visible and the cooperation made it possible to overcome these blind spots. This requires an open attitude and broad involvement from the museum organisation. Guiding often challenging processes and keeping all parties involved connected is of great importance in this new way of working. Streamlining these processes is one of my strengths and I get a lot of energy from it. 
This all let to a multi-sensory collection presentation which incorporates touch, smell and sound. Next to this you will find different perspectives on the artworks on show via de Smartify multimedia tours. An innovative and intuitive way of experiencing the exhibition. 

MORE INFO: 
> Introduction video (temporary version): youtube.com/watch?v=oVpyNaOpw-c  
> Information on the multimedia tours: 
- about.smartify.org/case-studies/the-van-abbemuseum 
- https://smartify.org/venues/van-abbemuseum 
> Press review: https://www.volkskrant.nl/cultuur-media/dwarsverbanden-in-het-van-abbe-nodigt-je-uit-om-steeds-opnieuw-te-kijken-voelen-en-ruiken~be0accbd/

projects.title: Who are we? - Traces of the colonial past in brabant
projects.description:
Victor Sonna's exhibition 1525 is accompanied by an extensive public program entitled Who are we? Traces of the colonial past in Brabant. In the program, participants and visitors are invited to reflect on the role that complex histories such as slavery and colonialism play in our lives. This project is on display in the Van Abbemuseum, in the form of a small-scale exhibition. The program was developed in collaboration with Vivian Heyms, Silvan Vasilda and a network of people from the province of Brabant, who all relate to colonial history from a matter of personal interest and/or family history. Who are we? offers everyone the opportunity to become acquainted with this complex history and to reflect on it in their own way.

PERSONAL RESEARCH
Central to this program are the personal quests of our core group: a group of 30 people from the larger Eindhoven area (and other cities in the province of Brabant) who reflect on their own experiences with traces of the colonial past. During a visit to the exhibition, you can get to know the participants through photos and personal stories and objects. It’s a joint process: from the recalibration and questioning of our past to the reflections on the present and imaginations of the future. This process will continue to develop until the summer of 2021. 

Partners: Huizen van Aankomst, Erfgoed Brabant.

projects.title: De Werksalon
projects.description:
The Van Abbemuseum is for everyone. It tells and collects stories that connect art to the world around us. But those who look closely, see that these stories are usually told by one group of people: the staff of the museum. This population is often white, well-educated and over forty years old. Therefore, they are not a good reflection of society. Yet this small group creates programs that are supposed to be for the whole society. Is the museum really for everyone? And are the stories that the museum tells and collects actually about the world around us?

At the Van Abbemuseum, we believe that a larger, multifaceted group of people should be given the space to tell stories. That is why we started the Werksalon in 2017. The Werksalon is a three-year program in which we, together with a number of groups from the city of Eindhoven, investigate how the stories and perspectives that are not yet shared, can get a place in the museum. This makes the museum more fun, interesting and recognizable for more people.

METHOD
Every season we invite a number of Eindhoven groups to the museum. Together with them we work towards an intervention within a year; each group develops its story and adds it to the collection presentation. 

NEWS
March 2019 we won Transformative Museum Grant together with The Whitworth in Manchester. This grant gives us the oppurtunity to develop the constiuent museum even further.
For more information: https://bit.ly/2THjVIT

projects.title: Art with Archipel - Artworks by elderly people (yearly event)
projects.description:
Clients, volunteers and staff members of Archipel (care home network) work on an intensive project every year. Where they work around a specific theme and translate this into a work of art. During workshops in the museum and locations of Archipel they looked at art together and they discovered the artist in themselves. In this way the collection of the museum and the creativity of this group comes together. 
Creating special and meaningfull encounters within the care home and the museum.
(The link directs you to the most recent project)

projects.title: Digitale Scheurkalenders (Digital Calenders)
projects.description:
* Schatten in de klas (Treasures in the classroom - national version) - May 2017
A calendar for the whole of the Netherlands: 12 museum treasures linked to language, biology, technology, media literacy, geography and history.
(Initiative of the Kröller-Müller Museum - Museum Education Prize 2015)
* Echt Eindhoven (Real Eindhoven) - September 2019
Specially made for students in the highest groups of primary education in Eindhoven. With 7 Eindhoven themes: Looking Differently, Nature and Universe, The Street, Inventors, Light, Buildings and 75 years of Freedom 2019-2020.

projects.title: UR ART Festival
projects.description: The interactive U R ART festival took place on 21 September on 7 locations in 5 European countries. This includes the Van Abbemuseum and that means an opportunity for everyone to discover the museum in a new way. With a program by and for the people of Eindhoven; bodily art experiences, various workshops, a multisensory tour and a  renewed theatrical tour. Next to this a meme workshop, an interactive sound artwork, various pop-up activities, a digital art-market and familly and children activities.

projects.title: Experimental mediation within 'The collection now' exhibition
projects.description:
Within the collection presentation 'The collection now' we developed two previous projects to a next level:

** Play Van Abbe roleplaying games > developed to a Toolshop 
The museum is aware that its own narrative is by definition incomplete. For this reason we invited people from outside the museum with different sorts of knowledge and backgrounds, to supplement the exhibition of the collection, 'The Collection Now', with their own stories and interpretations. This resulted in a broader range of stories and memories related to the collection, told by many different voices. Five tools were provided in the museum. These could be found in the Toolshop on the ground floor at the start of the exhibition.
More information: https://vanabbemuseum.nl/en/research/highlighted-projects/toolshop/ 

** The Viewing Depot >  developed into the DIY Archive
The archive was a combination of a storage facility, a workplace and an exhibition space. Visitors were invited to start work themselves, related to the real works of art in the collection dating from between 1965 and 1985, such as works by Andy Warhol, Richard Long, Gilbert and George, Richard Hamilton and Barry Flanagan.
The real works of art could be taken from the racks and placed in a temporary exhibition made by the visitors themselves, together with our own employees. Visitors were given the opportunity to look in the crates in storage containing small art objects and art books, and were permitted to root around in the video archives.
More information: https://vanabbemuseum.nl/en/research/highlighted-projects/diy-archive/ 
(More information Viewing Depot: https://vanabbemuseum.nl/en/research/highlighted-projects/kijkdepot/

projects.title: Flip the Museum - primary school kids take over the museum
projects.description:
With this project, children are the boss in the Van Abbemuseum. Pupils from groups 1 to 8 take the place of permanent employees of the museum - behind the counter, in security, as exhibition makers and as guides. Together they also provide a metamorphosis of the museum. What happens when the children are in charge; what would a museum look like?
(website info only in Dutch)

projects.title: Roleplaying game within the 'Play Van Abbe' exhibition
projects.description: Within the Play Van Abbe project the educational way of thinking made way for a more mediation way of thinking: lowering the authorical voice of the museum and creating more room for personal meaningful encounters for the visitors. By taking part in a roleplaying game the visitor had more agency over their own exploration through the museum. People where aslo invited to tag artworks with their own interpretations. These kinds of tools also open up the possibility for conversations amongst themselves but also with our mediators in the museum, such as our hosts and cicerone.

profile_positions.description:
Tilt is een literair productiehuis, gevestigd in Tilburg, vanuit waar we heel Brabant vertegenwoordigen. Tilt vertelt verhalen. Of dat nu op een podium, in een boek, een podcast of in een graphic novel is. Alle verhalen beginnen bij de taal. Schrijvers, performers en dichters brengen via taal hun verhalen tot leven. Tilt tilt ze op door het organiseren van schrijfopdrachten, auteurs residenties, presentaties en evenementen voor een breed publiek.

(Tilt is a literary production house based in Tilburg. Tilt tells stories. Whether on a stage, in a book, a podcast or in a graphic novel. Writers, performers and poets bring their stories to life through language. Tilt organises writing commissions, author residencies, presentations and events for a wide audience.)
profile_positions.title: Artistiek leider

profile_positions.description:
Bureau Drijfpunt develops meetings, debates and training on the cooperative thinking method. Participants experience and learn to reflect on and question considerations and ideas of themselves and others. A safe and equivalent conversation method that also makes it possible to address sensitive topics.
https://www.cooperatiefdenken.com/
profile_positions.title: Network Coordinator (voluntary)

company.name: Fontys Academie voor Beeldende Vorming, Tilburg

profile_positions.description:
From my experiences as art educator in the Van Abbemuseum I am asked to network/think tank meetings for feedback on the curriculum and activities. Next to that I am trained to sit in on assessments with students. During these assessment exams the students are asked about their development on a competence level.
Within my mentorship I guide students in the proces of their research and writing their master thesis, linked to the Master Art Education.
profile_positions.title: Member thinkstank / assessor / thesis mentor Master Art Education

profile_positions.description:
The main target of our mediation team is organising activities and creating tools and contexts for meaningful encounters. How to approach these meaningful encounters changed during the last 10 years within the Van Abbemuseum. The educational department evolved into a public mediation deparrtment with a holistic approach of the museum. Where all teams within the museum work together and with partners from outside the museum towards an inclusive museum.  

Please check out the accomplishments box, with a few projects I worked on.
profile_positions.title: Public Mediation

company.name: STUDIO i - platform voor inclusieve cultuur

profile_positions.location: Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam and Van Abbemuseum, Eindhoven
profile_positions.company: STUDIO i - platform voor inclusieve cultuur
profile_positions.description:
The aim of STUDIO i is to give a lasting impulse to accessibility and inclusion within the cultural field, by collecting and sharing knowledge, experience, inspiration, training and connect stakeholders.

https://studio-inclusie.nl/
profile_positions.title: Projectleader
